title: Introduction to Practice
description: In-depth analysis of practice principles. Students will develop critical thinking and problem-solving skills.

title: Introduction to Research
description: Comprehensive study of research with emphasis on theoretical foundations and practical applications.

title: Applied Applications
description: Comprehensive study of applications with emphasis on theoretical foundations and practical applications.

title: Applied Research
description: Fundamental concepts and applications of research. Designed for students pursuing careers in related fields.

title: Advanced Methods
description: Advanced exploration of methods covering current research and industry practices.

title: Applications
description: Fundamental concepts and applications of applications. Designed for students pursuing careers in related fields.

title: Research
description: Rigorous treatment of research theory and applications with emphasis on research methodology.

title: Special Topics in Methods
description: Interdisciplinary approach to methods combining theoretical knowledge with practical problem-solving.
prerequisites: PBHL 367 and senior standing or graduate status

title: Graduate Seminar
description: Examination of key concepts and methodologies in seminar. Includes hands-on experience and case studies.
prerequisites: PBHL 376 and senior standing or graduate status

title: Special Topics in Applications
description: Advanced exploration of applications covering current research and industry practices.
prerequisites: PBHL 338 and senior standing or graduate status

title: Graduate Methods
description: In-depth analysis of methods principles. Students will develop critical thinking and problem-solving skills.
prerequisites: PBHL 377 and senior standing or graduate status

title: Graduate Seminar
description: Comprehensive study of seminar with emphasis on theoretical foundations and practical applications.
prerequisites: PBHL 306 and senior standing or graduate status
